imdb.title: Cheer Danshi!
imdb.plot: Haruki Bandou trades Judo for cheerleading when his childhood friend Kazuma Hashimoto invites him to join the BREAKERS.

episodes.title: The Curtain Rises
episodes.plot: College freshman Haruki Bandou has practiced judo his whole life, but an injury and severe lack of self-confidence finally push him to give it up. His childhood friend Kazuma Hashimoto insists they start something new together: a men's cheerleading club.

episodes.title: Your First Cheerleader Smile
episodes.plot: The newly-formed Men's Cheerleading Club meets up with a stocky recruit and attempts to pull away two promising candidates from the Tennis Club.

episodes.title: The Seventh Squirrelurai
episodes.plot: The Men's Cheerleading Club needs one more member to make their debut, and they appear to have found the perfect candidate. There's just one problem.

episodes.title: What We Want to Break
episodes.plot: Having reached their goal of seven members, the squad begins practicing stunts for the first time, and even meets the Meishiin Women's Cheerleading Team, but things don't go as well as they hoped.

episodes.title: Let's Go, Breakers!
episodes.plot: As summer vacation begins, the Breakers start preparing for their debut, and must deal with Haruki's fear, an unexpected injury, and their overall lack of experience in the process.

episodes.title: Restart
episodes.plot: After a successful debut, the Breakers have their hands full with training new recruits and dealing with their conflicting personalities. Meanwhile, their self-appointed coach pressures Sho to confront his painful past.

episodes.title: Strain
episodes.plot: Tempers run high as the newly recruited, no-nonsense Hisashi clashes with his teammates over their lack of skills and commitment.

episodes.title: The Dawning of a Bond
episodes.plot: As the Breakers struggle to perfect their routine for the qualifiers, they debate whether to add even more difficult stunts, and Hisashi threatens to quit the team altogether.

episodes.title: Tears of the Sun
episodes.plot: Kazuma suddenly stops coming to practice, and his teammates speculate wildly about the reason for his absence.

episodes.title: What I Wanted to Tell You
episodes.plot: The Breakers head to the qualifiers, but Haruki seems distracted by his sister's troubles, while Sho struggles to deal with criticism from an old teammate.

episodes.title: Bittersweet Valentine
episodes.plot: As Valentine's Day approaches, Haruki attempts to repair his relationship with his sister, Haruko, but he has no idea where to start.

episodes.title: Cheer Boys!!
episodes.plot: On the eve of the National Cheerleading Championship, the Breakers receive an unexpectedly embarrassing opportunity for self-reflection.
